channel.title: Is it possible to run two scripts at once on the same char?
channel.description: For example, would it be posssible to run both an auto chopper and an auto talker at once or do I have to code both into a single script or is this not possible at all?

item.title: Is it possible to run two scripts at once on the same char?
item.dc:creator: @minitual minitual
item.description:
@minitual wrote:

(Back on track)
Wait, I don’t understand why you would ever want to run two scripts at the same time. You could simply program your autotyper into your autowoodcutter. For example:
program new;

begin
repeat
CutTree;
if(InvCount=28) then
DropAll;
AutoTalk;
until(false);
end.

Now this is obviously a horrible example but I think it gets the point across. I just don’t see the merit in running two scripts at the same time when you can do all the same things you could with two scripts that you could with one. Maybe I’m wrong…

Read full topic
item.source: Is it possible to run two scripts at once on the same char?
